description: This file implements the `DownloadManagerHttpClient` class, which manages HTTP file downloads using libcurl. It includes methods for initializing the HTTP client, downloading files with progress tracking, and handling cleanup. The code also contains callback functions for progress updates and data writing.

classes.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient
classes.description: A client class for managing HTTP downloads using libcurl, supporting file download with progress and cancellation.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the curl handle.

methods.name: ~DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Destructor that cleans up the curl handle.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient::Status downloadFile(const std::string & url,const std::string & fileName,uint32_t rateLimit)
methods.description: Downloads a file from a specified URL to a given filename with an optional rate limit.

methods.name: size_t progressCb(void * ptr,double dltotal,double dlnow,double ultotal,double ulnow)
methods.description: Static callback for tracking download progress.

methods.name: size_t write_data(void * ptr,size_t size,size_t nmemb,FILE * stream)
methods.description: Static callback for writing downloaded data to a file.

ctags.name: progressCb
ctags.pattern: /^size_t DownloadManagerHttpClient::progressCb(void *ptr, double dltotal, double dlnow, double ult/
